title: Fundamental rights in India
summary: Fundamental rights in India are the rights guaranteed under Part III (Articles 12-35) of the  Constitution of India. There are six fundamental rights (Article 12 - 35) recognised by the Indian constitutionÂ : the right to equality (Articles 14-18), the right to freedom (Articles 19-22), the right against exploitation (Articles 23-24), the right to freedom of religion (Articles 25-28), cultural and educational rights (Articles 29-30 ) and the right to constitutional remedies (Article 32 and 226).[1]
